summary: This is a Department of Justice afternoon news digest from March 5, 2020, summarizing headlines and news articles across various topics. It includes a brief mention of a criminal investigation into potential misconduct by guards at the Metropolitan Correctional Center where Jeffrey Epstein died, and the jail's lockdown status.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned as the financier who killed himself at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, which is now under investigation and lockdown.

persons.name: Bernard Madoff
persons.context: Prosecutors urged a judge to deny his early prison release from a 150-year sentence for his Ponzi scheme.

persons.name: William Barr
persons.context: Mentioned as being poised to make an announcement on child sexual abuse online and as a speaker at the National Opioid Summit. Also noted for using certification power in immigration cases.

persons.name: Michael Horowitz
persons.context: Cited in a report finding FBI efforts to identify homegrown violent extremists fell short.

persons.name: James Boasberg
persons.role: Chief Judge of the FISA court
persons.context: Wrote an opinion barring DOJ/FBI personnel under review from FISA work. Also invalidated Michigan Medicaid work requirements.

persons.name: Robert Mueller
persons.context: Referenced in relation to Russian disinformation efforts during the 2016 elections.

persons.name: Mariam Taha Thompson
persons.context: A contract linguist in Iraq charged with espionage for allegedly passing classified data to a man with ties to Hezbollah.

persons.name: Hector Fuentes
persons.context: A Mexican national pleaded not guilty to charges of working as a foreign agent for Russia.

persons.name: Gary Jones
persons.context: Charged with embezzling more than $1 million of UAW funds for personal use.

persons.name: R. Kelly
persons.context: Pleaded not guilty to an updated federal indictment including sex abuse allegations from a new accuser.

persons.name: Steve Greenberg
persons.context: Entered the not guilty plea on behalf of R. Kelly.

persons.name: John Roberts
persons.role: Chief Justice of the Supreme Court
persons.context: Condemned Senator Chuck Schumer's comments about Supreme Court justices.

persons.name: Chuck Schumer
persons.context: Expressed regret for remarks that Supreme Court justices would 'pay the price' for certain rulings.

persons.name: Donald Trump
persons.context: Mentioned in multiple contexts including immigration policy, judicial appointments, and a lawsuit for his tax returns.

persons.name: Jared Kushner
persons.context: Noted as continuing efforts with President Trump to build a coalition for immigration reform.

persons.name: Letitia James
persons.context: Reiterated commitment to holding opioid makers accountable as a trial date approaches.

events.title: DOJ Opens Investigation into MCC Contraband
events.description: The Justice Department opened a criminal investigation into potential misconduct by guards and the flow of contraband at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York, where Jeffrey Epstein died.

events.title: MCC Jail Lockdown
events.description: The Metropolitan Correctional Center had been on lockdown for six days in an effort to track down a smuggled gun, with inmates under 24-hour confinement.

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Financier Jeffrey Epstein killed himself at the Metropolitan Correctional Center.

events.title: Barr Announcement on Child Exploitation
events.description: Attorney General William Barr was poised to make an announcement, backed by leaders from four other countries, on efforts to address child sexual abuse online.

events.title: NY Opioid Trial Scheduled
events.description: A trial on claims brought by New York State against opioid manufacturers and distributors is set to begin.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, NY
keyFacts: The Justice Department opened a criminal investigation into potential guard misconduct and contraband flow at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) where Jeffrey Epstein died.
The MCC had been on a six-day lockdown in an effort to locate a smuggled gun.
The news digest is a broad compilation of DOJ-related news from March 5, 2020, with only a small portion directly related to the Epstein case.
Attorney General William Barr was featured in multiple news items, including an announcement on combating child sexual exploitation online.
The document shows the wide range of issues handled by the DOJ, from espionage and immigration to antitrust and civil rights.
